item.title: Jessica add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Richard Wilbur
item.description: "What is the opposite of two? A lonely me, a lonely you." -- Richard Wilbur

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "They say I'm old-fashioned, and live in the past, but sometimes I think progress progresses too fast!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jessica add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "You have plenty of courage, I am sure," answered Oz. "All you need is confidence in yourself. There is no living thing that is not afraid when it faces danger. The true courage is in facing danger when you are afraid, and that kind of courage you have in plenty." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Jessica add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "Hearts will never be practical until they can be made unbreakable. - Wizard" -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Jessica add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "Now I know I've got a heart because it is breaking. - Tin Man" -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Jessica add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "Never give up. No one knows what's going to happen next." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Jessica add a quote by L Frank Baum
item.description: "If I ever go looking for my heart's desire again, I won't look any further than my own back yard. Because if it isn't there, I never really lost it to begin with." -- L Frank Baum

item.title: Jessica add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "To 'know Thyself' is considered quite an accomplishment." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Let us make one point, that we meet each other with a smile, when it is difficult to smile. Smile at each other, make time for each other in your family." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Life is a game, play it." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "A sacrifice to be real must cost, must hurt, and must empty ourselves. Give yourself fully to God. He will use you to accomplish great things on the condition that you believe much more in his love than in your weakness." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Love begins by taking care of the closest ones - the ones at home." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Joy is a net of love in which you can catch souls." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "In the silence of the heart God speaks. If you face God in prayer and silence, God will speak to you. Then you will know that you are nothing. It is only when you realize your nothingness, your emptiness, that God can fill you with Himself. Souls of prayer are souls of great silence." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description:
"If you are kind, people may accuse you of selfish, ulterior motives: Be kind anyway.
If you are successful you will win some false friends and true enemies: Succeed anyway.
If you are honest and frank people will try to cheat you: Be honest anyway.
What you spend years building, someone could destroy overnight: Build anyway.
If you find serenity and happiness, they may be jealous of you: Be happy anyway.
The good you do today, will often be forgotten by tomorrow: Do good anyway.
Give the world the best you have, and it may never be enough: Give your best anyway." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Smile at each other. Smile at your wife, smile at your husband, smile at your children, smile at each other- it doesn't matter who it is- and that will help to grow up in greater love for each other." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "There are many people who can do big things, but there are very few people who will do the small things." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "We need to find God, and he cannot be found in noise and restlessness. God is the friend of silence. See how nature - trees, flowers, grass- grows in silence; see the stars, the moon and the sun, how they move in silence... We need silence to be able to touch souls. " -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa of Calcutta
item.description: "It is a kingly act to assist the fallen." -- Mother Teresa of Calcutta

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "I must be willing to give whatever it takes to do good to others. This requires that I be willing to give until it hurts. Otherwise, there is no true love in me, and I bring injustice, not peace, to those around me." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do... but how much love we put in that action" -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Spread love everywhere you go: first of all in your own home. Give love to your children, to your wife or husband, to a next door neighbor . . . Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness; kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile, kindness in your warm greeting." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts; but if he will be content to begin with doubts, he shall end in certainties." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Jessica add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "For last year's words belong to last year's language And next year's words await another voice." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver
